datasetStructure: One record per recorded intervention occurrence per subject

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AG.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AG.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AG.AGSEQ

datasetVariables.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
datasetVariables.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: AGSEQ

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AG.AGGRPID

datasetVariables.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
datasetVariables.label: Group ID
datasetVariables.name: AGGRPID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AG.AGSPID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number from the procedure or test page.
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
datasetVariables.name: AGSPID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AG.AGLNKID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains.This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship.
datasetVariables.label: Link ID
datasetVariables.name: AGLNKID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AG.AGLNKGRP

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains.This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.
datasetVariables.label: Link Group ID
datasetVariables.name: AGLNKGRP

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AG.AGTRT

datasetVariables.description: Verbatim medication name that is either preprinted or collected on a CRF.
datasetVariables.label: Reported Agent Name
datasetVariables.name: AGTRT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AG.AGMODIFY

datasetVariables.description: If AGTRT is modified to facilitate coding, then AGMODIFY will contain the modified text.
datasetVariables.label: Modified Reported Name
datasetVariables.name: AGMODIFY

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AG.AGDECOD

datasetVariables.description: Standardized or dictionary-derived text description of AGTRT or AGMODIFY. Equivalent to the generic medication name in WHO Drug. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document. If an intervention term does not have a decode value in the dictionary, then AGDECOD will be left blank.
datasetVariables.label: Standardized Agent Name
datasetVariables.name: AGDECOD

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AG.AGCAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to define a category of agent. Examples: "CHALLENGE AGENT", "PET TRACER".
datasetVariables.label: Category for Agent
datasetVariables.name: AGCAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AG.AGSCAT

datasetVariables.description: Further categorization of agent.
datasetVariables.label: Subcategory for Agent
datasetVariables.name: AGSCAT

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AG.AGPRESP

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate whether ("Y"/null) information about the use of a specific agent was solicited on the CRF.
datasetVariables.label: AG Pre-Specified
datasetVariables.name: AGPRESP

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AG.AGOCCUR

datasetVariables.name: AGOCCUR

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AG.AGSTAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate that a question about a prespecified agent was not answered. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".

datasetVariables.name: AGSTAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AG.AGREASND

datasetVariables.label: Reason Procedure Agent Not Collected
datasetVariables.name: AGREASND

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AG.AGCLAS

datasetVariables.description: Drug class. May be obtained from coding. When coding to a single class, populate with class value. If using a dictionary and coding to multiple classes, follow guidance in Section 4.2.8.3, Multiple Values for a Non-result Qualifier Variable, or omit AGCLAS.
datasetVariables.label: Agent Class
datasetVariables.name: AGCLAS

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AG.AGCLASCD

datasetVariables.description: Class code corresponding to AGCLAS. Drug class. May be obtained from coding. When coding to a single class, populate with class code. If using a dictionary and coding to multiple classes, follow guidance in Section 4.2.8.3, Multiple Values for a Non-result Qualifier Variable, or omit AGCLASCD.
datasetVariables.label: Agent Class Code
datasetVariables.name: AGCLASCD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AG.AGDUR

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66728

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AG.AGSTRF

datasetVariables.description: Describes the start of the agent relative to sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). If information such as "PRIOR", "ONGOING", or "CONTINUING" was collected, this information may be translated into AGSTRF. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
datasetVariables.label: Start Relative to Reference Period
datasetVariables.name: AGSTRF

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66728

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AG.AGENRF

datasetVariables.description: Describes the end of the agent relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). If information such as "PRIOR", "ONGOING", or "CONTINUING" was collected, this information may be translated into AGENRF. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
datasetVariables.label: End Relative to Reference Period
datasetVariables.name: AGENRF

datasetVariables.label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: AGSTRTPT

datasetVariables.description: Identifies the end of the agent as being before or after the reference time point defined by variable AGENTPT. Identifies the end of the agent as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable AGENTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
datasetVariables.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: AGENRTPT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AG.AGENTPT

datasetVariables.label: End Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: AGENTPT

description: An interventions domain that contains the agents administered to the subject as part of a procedure or assessment, as opposed to drugs, medications and therapies administered with therapeutic intent.
label: Procedure Agents
name: AG
